parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Or ekchuno ek-khoo'-no from ek and cheo; to pour forth; figuratively, to bestow.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Richly, abundantly. Adverb from plousios; copiously.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
